channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Midwest tornadoes cause severe damage in Omaha suburbs
item.description: Multiple tornadoes were reported in Nebraska but the most destructive storm moved from a largely rural area into suburbs northwest of Omaha. Hundreds of homes and other structures have been damaged.
item.content:encoded:
Multiple tornadoes were reported in Nebraska but the most destructive storm moved from a largely rural area into suburbs northwest of Omaha. Hundreds of homes and other structures have been damaged.

(Image credit: Chris Machian)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Biden administration abandons plan to ban menthol cigarettes, citing 'feedback'
item.description: An anti-smoking advocate says the decision to leave menthol cigarettes on the market "prioritizes politics over lives, especially Black lives."
item.content:encoded:
An anti-smoking advocate says the decision to leave menthol cigarettes on the market "prioritizes politics over lives, especially Black lives."

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: In Columbia University's protests of 1968 and 2024, what's similar — and different
item.description: There are parallels between the two high-profile events, most starkly the proliferation of similar protests around the country. But key differences set them apart.
item.content:encoded:
There are parallels between the two high-profile events, most starkly the proliferation of similar protests around the country. But key differences set them apart.

(Image credit: Leonardo Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Climate activist who defaced Edgar Degas sculpture exhibit sentenced
item.description: A federal judge sentenced Joanna Smith to 60 days in prison for smearing paint on the case surrounding Edgar Degas' Little Dancer, Aged Fourteen at the National Gallery of Art.
item.content:encoded:
Little Dancer sculpture in 2023.'/>

A federal judge sentenced Joanna Smith to 60 days in prison for smearing paint on the case surrounding Edgar Degas' Little Dancer, Aged Fourteen at the National Gallery of Art.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: DRC is seeing its worst mpox outbreak — but has no vaccines or treatments yet. Why?
item.description: With nearly 5,000 cases reported so far this year — and concerns about a new strain — the Democratic Republic of Congo is considering the declaration of a public health emergency.
item.content:encoded:
With nearly 5,000 cases reported so far this year — and concerns about a new strain — the Democratic Republic of Congo is considering the declaration of a public health emergency.

(Image credit: Alain Jocard)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Net neutrality is back: U.S. promises fast, safe and reliable internet for all
item.description: The U.S. will reinstate Obama-era regulations for internet service providers that promise fast, reliable and fair internet speeds for all consumers. What happened when those rules were taken away?
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. will reinstate Obama-era regulations for internet service providers that promise fast, reliable and fair internet speeds for all consumers. What happened when those rules were taken away?

(Image credit: Michael Bocchieri)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: King Charles III is returning to royal duties after his cancer diagnosis
item.description: Buckingham Palace hasn't said what type of cancer Charles had or if he's finished treatment. It said he'll make a public visit to a cancer clinic Tuesday and will welcome Japan's emperor in June.
item.content:encoded:
Buckingham Palace hasn't said what type of cancer Charles had or if he's finished treatment. It said he'll make a public visit to a cancer clinic Tuesday and will welcome Japan's emperor in June.

(Image credit: Hollie Adams)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: A baby girl born orphaned and premature after an Israeli airstrike in Gaza has died
item.description: The newborn died after five days in an incubator. Her family was killed in an air strike. UNICEF says 13,000 children have been killed in Gaza since Oct. 7, with thousands more orphaned and wounded.
item.content:encoded:
The newborn died after five days in an incubator. Her family was killed in an air strike. UNICEF says 13,000 children have been killed in Gaza since Oct. 7, with thousands more orphaned and wounded.

(Image credit: Mohammed Salem)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Delta flight makes emergency return after exit slide separates from Boeing aircraft
item.description: The Los Angeles-bound flight was forced to make an emergency return to New York's JFK airport after an emergency slide came apart from the Boeing 767, the airline said.
item.content:encoded:
The Los Angeles-bound flight was forced to make an emergency return to New York's JFK airport after an emergency slide came apart from the Boeing 767, the airline said.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: C Mandler

item.title: Taylor Swift fans mean business with Tortured Poets soap, Eras yarn, Kelce cookies
item.description: Entrepreneurial Swifties are selling crafty products inspired by Taylor Swift's music and style. Swift herself has been known to send notes and even homemade gifts to creative super-fans.
item.content:encoded: Entrepreneurial Swifties are selling crafty products inspired by Taylor Swift's music and style. Swift herself has been known to send notes and even homemade gifts to creative super-fans.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman
